p: We sequenced smRNAs from seven successive stages of seed development and leaves from a small‐seeded (Himchana 1 with seed weight of 13.1 ± 0.15 g per 100 seeds) and a large‐seeded (JGK 3 with seed weight of 53.3 ± 1.48 g per 100 seeds) chickpea cultivar. The stages of seed development included embryogenesis (S1–S3), mid‐maturation (S4 and S5), and late‐maturation (S6 and S7) stages as described earlier (Garg et al., 2017). In total, about 1 billion raw reads were obtained after sequencing representing an average of 34 million raw reads for each sample (Table S2). About 70% of the total reads of different lengths were obtained after removing low‐quality reads and those with adapter contamination (Figure S1). The high‐quality filtered reads were made non‐redundant, which represented smRNAs (Figure S2a). We detected highest fraction of 24‐nt smRNAs in all the samples analyzed (Figure S2b) as reported in previous studies (Jain et al., 2014; Liu et al., 2014; Ma et al., 2018).
